data.title: Rex Harrison
data.text:
AKA Reginald Carey Harrison

Born: 5-Mar-1908

Birthplace: Huyton, Lancashire, England

Died: 2-Jun-1990

Location of death: New York City

Cause of death: Cancer - Pancreatic

Remains: Cremated (ashes scattered on Lake Portofino, Italy, and on Lili Palmer's grave)

Gender: Male

Race or Ethnicity: White

Sexual orientation: Straight

Occupation: Actor

Nationality: England

Executive summary: My Fair Lady

Wife: Collette Thomas (m. 1934, div. 1942, one child)

Wife: Rachel Roberts (actress, m. 21-Mar-1962, div. 1971)

Wife: Lilli Palmer (actress, m. 25-Jan-1943, div. 6-Feb-1957, one child)

Wife: Kay Kendall (actress, m. 1957, d. 1959)

Wife: Elizabeth Harris (m. 1971, div. 1975)

Wife: Mercia Tinker (m. 1978)

Slept with: Carole Landis (he discovered the body after Carole's suicide)

Son: Noel Harrison (actor, b. 29-Jan-1934, with Marjorie Thomas)

Son: Carey Harrison (with Lilli Palmer)

Oscar for Best Actor 1965 for My Fair Lady

Golden Globe 1965 for My Fair Lady

Tony

Hollywood Walk of Fame 6380 Hollywood Blvd. (television)

Hollywood Walk of Fame 6906 Hollywood Blvd. (motion pictures)

Knight of the British Empire 1989

Missing Eye (glass eye, childhood illness)

FILMOGRAPHY AS ACTOR

Anastasia: The Mystery of Anna (7-Dec-1986)

A Time to Die (1982)

The Fifth Musketeer (6-Apr-1979)

Ashanti (9-Mar-1979)

Crossed Swords (17-Mar-1978)

Shalimar (1978)

Staircase (20-Aug-1969)

A Flea in Her Ear (19-Oct-1968)

Doctor Dolittle (5-Dec-1967) · Dr. John Dolittle

The Honey Pot (21-Mar-1967) · Cecil Fox

The Agony and the Ecstasy (24-Sep-1965)

The Yellow Rolls-Royce (31-Dec-1964) · The Marquess of Frinton

My Fair Lady (21-Oct-1964) · Henry Higgins

Cleopatra (12-Jun-1963) · Julius Caesar

The Happy Thieves (Jan-1962) · Jim Bourne

Midnight Lace (13-Oct-1960) · Anthony Preston

The Reluctant Debutante (14-Aug-1958) · Jimmy Broadbent

The Constant Husband (16-May-1955)

King Richard and the Crusaders (7-Aug-1954) · Emir Ilderim

Main Street to Broadway (13-Oct-1953) · Himself

The Four Poster (8-Oct-1952) · John Edwards

Unfaithfully Yours (6-Dec-1948) · Sir Alfred De Carter

Escape (Mar-1948)

The Foxes of Harrow (24-Sep-1947)

The Ghost and Mrs. Muir (26-Jun-1947) · Capt. Daniel Gregg

Anna and the King of Siam (20-Jun-1946) · King Mongkut

The Rake's Progress (29-Dec-1945)

A Yank in London (20-Jul-1945)

Blithe Spirit (14-May-1945) · Charles Condomine

Major Barbara (14-May-1941)

Night Train to Munich (31-Aug-1940) · Gus Bennett

Over the Moon (19-Oct-1939) · Dr. Freddie Jarvis

The Citadel (3-Nov-1938) · Dr. Lawford

Sidewalks of London (18-Oct-1938) · Harley Prentiss

Storm in a Teacup (25-Feb-1937) · Frank Burdon

Men Are Not Gods (26-Nov-1936) · Tommy Stapleton

Author of books:

A Damned Serious Business: My Life in Comedy (1991, memoir)
